intro: Diplazium filamentosum, commonly known as the filamentous water fern, is a species of aquatic fern found in wetland and marsh environments. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that often appear in dense clusters. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread vegetatively through underground stems. Its small, sporangia are typically clustered in sori on the underside of the fronds. Diplazium filamentosum plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
